name: Last Tome
flavorProject: A fount of ancient knowledge, almost dried up now. Contains enough information to allow us to mount a response to the Primordials. It'll serve us well as the cornerstone of our research
flavorTech: Here the philosophers and academicians conduct their research, poring over dusty tomes and phos scripture

abilityText.value: node on the Timeline, research one of the available Technology cards from the corresponding Projects Deck
During the Exploration Step, if the Argo is on an unexplored Map Tile with
token on your current Story card or the Inward Odyssey card

name: Primordial Dawn
flavorProject: Not much is known about the Eschaton, except that it brought the Fall of Olympus and the Coming of the Primordials
flavorTech: From here the Argonauts shape their fate and steer the mighty Argo towards its unknown destination

abilityText.value: At the start of each day you move to an adjacent tile using one of the available waterways
If needed, place the tile, then move the Argo and proceed to the Timeline Step
During the Adventure Step, if the Argo is on an unexplored Map tile with the
symbol, go to the Adventure Hubs table in your current Cycle's Storybook
During the Exploration Step after resolving Exploration symbols, draw and resolve two stacks of Exploration cards

name: Antikratos Project
flavorProject: There is a lot we do not know about the Triskelion Junction used in the process of supressing the atavistic nature of the Titans. We need to know more
flavorTech: Here the Argonauts ready for their next excursion and it is also here that a Support Team stands ready to lend their help

name: Argo Works
flavorProject: The Argo is a marvel of engineering, but there's no denying the fact that most of its systems are inactive or unknown to us. We need to start by setting up a production hub
flavorTech: To stand a chance against the Primordials, the smiths and priests of the Argo work tirelessly on new types of @Gear and new engineering solutions

abilityText.value: During the Advancement Step, you can use available resources to craft

name: Titanogenesis
flavorProject: They are a mystery to us. Mindless and extremely violent in the wild, they would be Mortalkind greatest enemy, had it not been for the Eschaton. Now they're our best hope for the future
flavorTech: Here the Titans are tamed and stored when not in use. Some call this place a warehouse. some call it a prison

abilityText.value: During the Exploration Step, if the Argo is on an unexplored Map Tile with the

name: Trading Solutions
flavorProject: If we are to survive, we need to strengthen our connection to the people of Crete
flavorTech: A small ship dock will allow us to take in traders and establish connections around the island

abilityText.value: Add the Theban Trader Exploration card to the Exploration deck
1 Calcified Knuckle Bone or Fleshy Mantle
1 Calcified Knuckle Bone or Fleshy Mantle

name: Intelligence Gathering
flavorProject: If we are to master our fate, we need to know what lies ahead. This is the first step in establishing a permanent informant network
flavorTech: Your informants will periodically bring you news - good or otherwise

abilityText.value: Exploration card to the Exploration deck

name: Shallows Navigation
flavorProject: The phos scriptures tell of a dormany subsystem of the Argo's engines that allows shallow water navigation
flavorTech: The Argo rises above the waterline and almost glides on the river surface

name: Rhetoric
flavorProject: The Labyrinthians talk about nothingness with devout passion. We need a message of our own
flavorTech: Let all who doubt their purpose despair not, for this ship is in itself a message: we are here for a reason

abilityText.value: when you are about to gain

name: Diplomatic Relations
flavorProject: We've walked blindly into this crisis. Now's the time to learn about the island and acclimate
flavorTech: Our envoys establish our presence on the island

abilityText.value: Lose 4 Mortal resources of your choosing and gain +1
to gain +1 Diplomacy with the Local Faction

name: Pursuer Problem
flavorProject: That creature does not tire nor rest. It will not stop hunting us. We need time to figure out how to kill it
flavorTech: Engines grow silent though the Argo still moves, like Charon's boat

abilityText.value: during Adversary Activation to lower the Adversary movement by 1 (to a minimum of 0)
This does not stop Adversary from spawning!

name: Peace
flavorProject: It's never too late to reconcile your differences
flavorTech: And with an offering, let past grievances fade away

abilityText.value: Choose 1 Faction you are At War with and immediately set your Diplomacy Score with this Faction to '-8'
This ability ignores the normal restrictions of the 'At War' Diplomacy Threshold

name: Anti-Indoctrination Philosophy
flavorProject: The message of the Labyrinthians is insidious, as it takes root in fear and fear is constant. We must guard against it
flavorTech: The Philosopher Guards quickly became a beacon around which the discourse of Purpose flourished

abilityText.value: Success: Chosen Argonaut discards a Despair token
Lose -1 Priest to make one Argonaut lose the Mazetouched Affliction

name: Hope Logic
flavorProject: For nothingness does not exist without Purpose to which it stands in opposition. It fears it and tries to douse it with doubt
flavorTech: And in that moment it betrays its weakness. For if there was no Hope of Purpose prevailing, why go to such lengths to silence it? Hope

abilityText.value: when you are about to gain
during the Voyage or Adventure Phase to test (X+), where X is 9 minus the number of your current Doom card

name: Argo Onboarding
flavorProject: Without proper parts and equipment, we cannot bring the ship to its full potential. But we are learning
flavorTech: There are certain things we can do to minimize the impact hull damage has on our voyage

abilityText.value: During the Exploration Step, if the
is on an unexplored Map tile with the
when you are about to lose
during the Voyage or Adventure Phase to test (X+), where X is 3 plus your current

name: Deeply Embedded Spies
flavorProject: The news of our exploits brings hope to many. Some want to repay that renewed sense of purpose and help our cause
flavorTech: Along our journey we made a difference for a lot of people and that selflessness pays out in dividends

abilityText.value: is on an explored Map tile with the

name: Excursion Propylon II
flavorProject: These Primordials are getting too much to handle. The Argo must rise to the challenge
flavorTech: The rebuilt Propylon will allow the Argo a far greater presence during battles

name: Mnestis Thesis
flavorProject: These glimpses we're having, these past lives... there must be an easier way to access them
flavorTech: From here we rise and to here we are brought when we cease to be. There are answers in this chamber, only thing we need to do is listen

abilityText.value: and write an Argonaut's name on the Timeline (event), 7 days from now
You cannot use this ability again until you resolve this event
When you resolve this event, the Argonaut gains +1 Mnemos Node for a chosen Mnemos card

name: Minoan Investigations
flavorProject: We need to follow up on these loose threads, who knows where they can lead us..
flavorTech: Regular scouting expeditions are starting to bear fruit

abilityText.value: You may re-roll your Adventure Hubs Table roll (once)

name: Titan Hunting
flavorProject: There's only a handful of Titans onboard the Argo. If we are meant to survive, we need to... procure more
flavorTech: Only philosophers are able to subdue wild Titans and bring them to the Argo, but they refuse to share their secrets

abilityText.value: Exploration card to the Exploration deck
when the Argo is on a Map tile with

name: Titan Rearing
flavorProject: A set of rules and practices that will allow us to house more Titans effectively
flavorTech: With the new practices in place, we can expand our Titan roster

abilityText.value: If you win a Battle that you started with less than 4 Titans, after the Battle gain +X
to gain as many Dreamwalker Titans as to have a total of 4 Titans in the Stoa
X is the number of Titans gained

name: Archeolinguistics
flavorProject: These symbols are not merely decorative...
flavorTech: It is a language, long forgotten. With time, we may learn to decipher it

abilityText.value: During your Voyages, you will encounter other glyphs that will help you decode the Centimanes Scripts (sequences of glyphs) and find the secret Centimanes paragraphs in the Main Story
These will be denoted by a
at the beginning of the paragraph
If the paragraph doesn't show this symbol, you must've made a mistake in your decoding -- don't read it! If that's the case, gain +1

name: Advanced Trading Solutions
flavorProject: Remember the old saying: "You do not win a war with swords. You win it with bread."
flavorTech: Your agents arrive in town before the Argo and lay the groundwork for successful negotiations

abilityText.value: First time you use a Negotiation Ability each day, you may ignore its associated

name: Crew Expansion
flavorProject: A lot of the men and women who joined us on Kephallonia have died or departed. If we don't replace them, we'll soon command a ship of ghosts
flavorTech: There's a lot of people who enlist only for the promise of a roof over their head and a bowl of warm soup. We need to watch them closely, for they may prove flighty

name: Advanced Crew Expansion
flavorProject: We need to send out recruiters who actively look for volunteers to our cause
flavorTech: Each time only a few brace to join our ranks. The most determined, strong-willed and driven. We wouldn't have it any other way

abilityText.value: when you are about to lose
during the Voyage or Adventure Phase to test (Diplomacy 7+)

name: Superior Trading Solutions
flavorProject: Argo is a big ship. A floating city. It's time to bring commerce to us

name: Spark of the Dead Gods
flavorProject: The gods may be dead, but they left plenty of evidence of their existence and passing
flavorTech: In this temple to the fleeting memory of tyrannous idols, fates are shaped and powers seized

abilityText.value: From now on you can Awaken! (See Rulebook)
When you gain a Godform, note it on the Argo Sheet in the Godforms section

name: Strange Alliance
flavorProject: The Olympians are dead, their Mount razed and their cults scattered. Howbeit, nature abhors a vacuum
flavorTech: The Nymphs are completely alien to us, their motives unknown and unscrupulous. Yet they may be bargained with...

abilityText.value: and lose -2 Priests to regain a spent Summon Charge

abilities.name: Gain +2 @ArgoFate and +2 @Doom to regain a spent Summon Charge

name: Forgotten Knowledge
flavorProject: The Last Tome has much to teach us still, its one and only page, written in phos scripture, divulges new information each time it is used
flavorTech: Here the philosophers and academicians conduct their research, pouring over dusty tomes and phos scriptures

abilityText.value: When you start a new Cycle II campaign, tak eall of the Combat and Structural Technology cards you have researched and remove all that have the 'Cycle I only' tag
You won't need those in Cycle II
Note that you will also have a very limited use of Cycle I Production Facilities, so you may remove these cards too
if they would exceed this limit

name: Argo's Mission
flavorProject: Your time on Crete has changed you, you now have a purpose. To bring hope and peace to a post-Eschaton world
flavorTech: From here the Argonauts shape their fate and steer the mighty Argo towards its victory

name: Nietzschean Sighting
flavorProject: The Spartan summons and controls the Nietzschean monster, seemingly at will and from thin air

abilityText.value: If a Titan is crippled, it is not killed
It still takes space in the Titan Stoa, but you cannot junction with it in Battle, use it for Titan Breeding, or lose it as a penalty for any reason

name: Temenos Project
flavorProject: Temenos was a formidable foe. Even in death, his body retains transformative properties and his maze shell is harder than stone
flavorTech: In one of the vast holds of the Argo, the carcass of Temenos is mind for valuable resources. The pit of despair transformed into a font of hope

abilityText.value: The Exploration deck has several cards showing your mining efforts
These cards award you with Temenos Primordial resources
If you are on Story 2A or further, during Advancement Steop you may trade these resources for War Triremes (any number of times):

name: Argo Works II
flavorProject: Alkibiades Argo Works is the living, beating heart of the ship. This is where dreams become reality
flavorTech: To stand a chance against the Primordials, the smiths and priests of the Argo work tirelessly on new types of gear and new engineering solutions

abilityText.value: When instructed to apply Ascendency rules, all Gear cards with a Power Level lower than II (and without the Ascended keyword) incur the following penalties for the remainder of the Cycle:
(Weapons only) When you attack with this weapon, you cannot use any tokens from the Kratos Pool or place any tokens in the Kratos Pool

name: Titanomorphosis
flavorProject: As we learn more about the Titans and their tendencies, we unlock some of their hidden potential: we call it Argo Breeding
flavorTech: Here the Titans are tamed and stored when not in use. Some call this place a warehouse, some call it a prison

abilityText.value: Unlike Fused Titans, Titans created through Titan Breeding don't require a Primordial Core, unless it is specifically stated

name: Mnestis Theater
flavorProject: A chamber in which a user can experience an illusory physical environment could be the greatest of training rooms
flavorTech: What would Plato say of us now? Shadows casting shadows?

name: Nymph Studies
flavorProject: We know the Nymphs can be persuaded to help our cause, it's just a matter of finding out the best way to appease them
flavorTech: Do they have a stake in this game? Or are we mere playthings?

name: Political Protection
flavorProject: There may be some who oppose the Nietzschean's rule. If we grant them protectoin, they may server as a useful source of information
flavorTech: Defectors and informants risk their lives to help your cause

abilityText.value: Lose -1 Defector when you are about to perform a Diplomacy test or any test or roll in the Adventure Phase to add +3 to the result

name: Refugee Relief Effort
flavorProject: The war is displacing whole communities. We can offer them a safe haven
flavorTech: There is nothing more satisfying than the look on the faces of a family reunited

abilityText.value: to gain +1 Humanity and +1 Diplomacy with the Local Faction
Lose -1 Priest to make one Argonaut lose the Black Breath Affliction

name: Recruitment Programs
flavorProject: The war is taking its toll on your crew. You need to double your recruitment efforts. The refugees are more than eager to volunteer
flavorTech: This is their chance to make things right, reclaim their homes and their lives

name: Refugee Integration
flavorProject: The once nigh-indestructible Argo has seen better days. There are too many repairs to perform and too few hands to carry them out
flavorTech: You crew and your refugee friends work hand in hand to keep the Argo going

abilityText.value: when you are about to lose
during the Voyage or Adventure Phase, to test (X+), where X is 9 minus the number of Refugees you have

name: Spartan Investigations
flavorProject: Your experiences on Crete dictate you should establish a robust scout network
flavorTech: Your scouts direct you to the places you're most needed at

abilityText.value: After you roll on the Adventure Hubs table, you may choose to resolve an adventure from the hub you rolled or the one in the row directly above

name: Theseus Method
flavorProject: The next logical step. The Nietzschean is waging a shadow war, the sooner you muster your own shadow warriors, the better
flavorTech: The work of a spy is thankless, but it saves lives

abilityText.value: Exploration card to the Exploration deck

name: Grassroot Support
flavorProject: Establishing relations with the local populations will help in your information gathering efforts
flavorTech: There is something here, the Symmachy would call it synoikismos. You would call it unity of purpose

abilityText.value: is on an explored tile with the

name: Mobile Trade Fleet Dock
flavorProject: Trading is almost impossible in times of war. But smuggling isn't trading
flavorTech: The Thebans, the Nubians, the various unaligned movers: they all smell opportunity

abilityText.value: Exploration card to the Exploration deck

name: Alliance Contacts
flavorProject: We need to be heard, we need to be seen. The people of Sparta need to know we come to help
flavorTech: Trust is slow to build, but it is always worth it

abilityText.value: If Hidden or Distrustful with the Local Faction, lose a total of X Maze Fragment, Fear Essence, and/or Mortal resources to gain +1 to this Faction's Diplomacy value
X is your current Diplomacy value with this Faction
and lose 4 Relief resources to add the
Exploration card to the Exploration deck

name: Mobile Trade Fleet Hub
flavorProject: Turning the Trade Fleet Dock into a mobile smuggler haven will allow us free access to goods from all over Sparta

name: Canal Reconnaissance
flavorProject: Great River Works. And here you thought you were done with mazes. It's time to map them out

abilityText.value: Place a generic token on this card
If the Hemiolia token is on this card, choose an unexplored Map tile number adjacent to the
Reveal that tile and place the Hemiolia token on it
If the Hemiolia token is on a Map tile, test Diplomacy (8+) to recall it (use the Diplomacy modifier of the Local Faction on the tile with the Hemiolia token)
Place the Hemiolia token on this card
When you move onto the tile with the Hemiolia token, you must immediately resolve the ability above, adding +3 to the result
If the Hemiolia token is discarded, lose 5 Trireme or 2 War Trireme resources and gain +1
Event to the Timeline, 4 days from now
When you resolve this event, place the Hemiolia token on this card

name: Up-stream Navigation
flavorProject: Argo's aeolipile engines are running on a fraction of their maximum power, or so the engineers claim. Let's put it to the test
flavorTech: Argo cannot take a continued strain on its engines. But in short bursts, it can be tactically advantageous

abilities.name: Gain +1 @ArgoFate during the Movement Step to test (8+).<<NL>>*Success

name: Sluice Gate System Integration
flavorProject: There is a Second Cataract up north. If we integrate the Ignition system into the Argo, we won't even need to take a gate fortress
flavorTech: An onboard machina breaks the gate's cypher and sends a counterfeit signal

abilityText.value: waterways with the Second Cataract symbol

name: Argo Security
flavorProject: There are many people coming onboard the Argo nowadays, too many to count. We need to tighten security
flavorTech: You can recognize the Guard Mora soldiers by the red stripes on their uniforms

abilityText.value: when you are about to lsoe
during the Voyage or Adventure Phase to test Diplomacy (7+)

name: War Recruitment
flavorProject: Many among our Allies' ranks wish to serve on the Argo. It's time we let them
flavorTech: Many volunteers flock to our cause

name: War Propylon
flavorProject: The original Propylon wasn't built to handle war operations
flavorTech: It's comforting to know the Argo has your back

name: Wartime Protocols
flavorProject: The Argo wasn't built as a warship, but it needs to become one
flavorTech: You promise yourselves, you will dismantle most of this Ares-cursed equipment once the war is over

name: Argo Maintenance
flavorProject: As Alkibiades and his crews learn the ins and outs of the Argo, more on the fly repairs become a possibility - provided you have access to a shipyard
flavorTech: There is a lot of shared concepts between the Symmachy's vessels designs and the Argo. Though the latter seems aeons ahead, technologically

name: Titan Breeding
flavorProject: The anitkratos philosophers are ready to expand their Titan work
flavorTech: Your time on Crete has left you with a purpose - and new Titans to help you along the way

abilityText.value: Lose 1 Dreamwalker Titan to note a Mazerunner, Earthshaker,
Event on the Timeline, 10 days from now
When you resolve this event, gain one Titan of the corresponding class
You cannot use this ability again until you resolve the event
to use Cretan Strains Breeding with Cooldown: 12 days
If you do, write the chosen Breeding event 5 days from now instead

name: Grand Stoa
flavorProject: A new home for your Titans
flavorTech: As the Stoa expands, you are able to sustain a growing herd of Titans

abilityText.value: Event on the Timeline, 9 days from now
When you resolve this event, gain 1 Dreamwalker Titan
You cannot use this ability again until you resolve this event

name: Titan Training
flavorProject: Titans are natural warriors. But what if you trained them?

abilityText.value: Form the Gymnasion deck: Find all Cycle I and Cycle II Pattern cards and all Pattern cards that you gained in Cycle III (except the ones currently assigned to Titans)

abilities.name: Gain +1 @ArgoFate to note a _Titan's name (Training)_ Event on the Timeline, 7 days from now. When you resolve this event, that Titan may gain one of the Pattern (Training) or Pattern (Conditioning) cards from the Gymnasion deck. You cannot use this ability again until you resolve this event

name: Old Transportation System
flavorProject: The Helots tell of old roads for ships. It's worth investigating
flavorTech: The diolkos network, though ancient, is still usable. Such is the legacy of Leleges stonework

name: Counterintelligence
flavorProject: The Argo has been infiltrated by spies and saboteurs. It's time to weed them out
flavorTech: Krypteia has found its match

abilityText.value: Remove a random Sabotage card from the Exploration deck
For the purpose of Sabotage card effects, treat your

name: Trauma Growth
flavorProject: The Nietzschean's propensity for cruelty has left your Titans crippled. That was his mistake
flavorTech: Trauma is nothing to strive for, but when it happens, it is a chance for a rebirth

abilityText.value: event on the Timeline, 7 days from now
When you resolve this event, the chosen Titan stops being crippled
You cannot use this ability again until you resolve this event
Chosen Argonaut loses the Consumed by Rage Affliction

name: Ambrosia Spill Solution
flavorProject: The Argo Works are certain they can use the technology of the Aeolipilean Engineroom to combat ambrosia
flavorTech: The liquifier breaks the bonds of the ambrosia mass, making it easier to navigate or harvest

abilityText.value: Exploration card to discard it without resolving its effect and gain 3 Violent Ambrosia resources

name: First Tome
flavorProject: You have clung to the Last Tome as the last vestige of a dying civiliization. But you had it all wrong. It all starts here. It's not the Last Tome. It's the First
flavorTech: Should we call it the First Academy then? No, let it confuse our adversaries

abilityText.value: When you start a new Cycle II campaign, tak eall of the Combat and Structural Technology cards you have researched and remove all that have the 'Cycle I only' tag
You won't need those in Cycle II
Note that you will also have a very limited use of Cycle I Production Facilities, so you may remove these cards too
if they would exceed this limit

name: Argo's Destiny
flavorProject: The Nietzschean War is over and the Argo sets course for Delphi, the last open wound of the Eschaton
flavorTech: From here the Argonauts defy their fate and steer the mighty Argo towards a brighter future

name: Abyss Expedition
flavorProject: Not much was left of the Nietzschean, a puddle of boiling ambrosia. It bubbled and churned and was deemed to dangerous to leave in Sparta. So you to took it with you, to safeguard and study
flavorTech: This is a dangerous place, it's easy to get swallowed by the enormity and totality of the Nietzschean's echo, but also of raw power. You will harness it for good

abilityText.value: The Exploration deck has several cards showing your efforts to tame the power of the pool
These cards award you with Nietzschean Primordial resources
If you are on Story 2A or further, during Advancement Steop you may trade these resources for Hyperborean Alloy (any number of times):

name: Argo Works III
flavorProject: Alkibiades Argo Works is the living, beating heart of the ship. This is where dreams become reality
flavorTech: To stand a chance against the Primordials, the smiths and priests of the Argo work tirelessly on new types of gear and new engineering solutions

abilityText.value: When instructed to apply Ascendency rules, all Gear cards with a Power Level lower than III (and without the Ascended keyword) incur the following penalties for the remainder of the Cycle:
(Weapons only) When you attack with this weapon, you cannot use any tokens from the Kratos Pool or place any tokens in the Kratos Pool

name: Titanoaristia
flavorProject: The Titans have come through for us in Sparta. We need to acknowledge they're more than just animals
flavorTech: When the Antikratos Protocols are loosened, the Titans begin to exhibit a wide array of emotions

abilityText.value: Each time a Titan dies in Battle, other Titans may gain +1
In addition, when a Titan survives an Obol Draw, they may gain +1
Unliked Fused Titans, Titans created through Titan Breeding don't require a Primordial Core, unless it is specifically stated

name: Surviving The Loop
flavorProject: When the loop resets, everyhing resets. Except the Argo

abilityText.value: During the Exploration Step, if the Argo is on a Map tile with a
symbol, you may move Ariadne's Anchor token to that Map tile

name: Chronosail
flavorProject: With a sufficiently powerful chronosail, we might be able to force the loop to quicken
flavorTech: Passage of time in Delphi is inexplicably tied to the Sun

abilityText.value: to immediately resolve the Loop effect

name: Trespass Protocol
flavorProject: We need to gain access to the Past
flavorTech: A breaker capable of punching through the fabric of spacetime

abilities.name: Permanent. You can move through @Lock waterways with the @PastPortal symbol

name: Icebreaker Protocol
flavorProject: We need to be able to traverse the Future
flavorTech: A reinforced breaker that will take you to the very end of time

abilities.name: Permanent. You can move through @Lock waterways with the @FuturePortal symbol

name: Time Wounds
flavorProject: These erratic portals lead through space, not time
flavorTech: An engine capable of punching through a Time Wound

abilityText.value: Gain +1 ArgoFate to travel through a

name: Time Solutions
flavorProject: If the icebergs contain frozen time, we may be able to extract it
flavorTech: Time is malleable..

abilityText.value: 3 (You cannot gain Frozen Time if it would exceed your Time Silo limit)
Lose -1 Frozen Time to extend your current Loop by 1

name: Advanced Time Solutions
flavorProject: With proper callibrations we may steal some time from the next loop
flavorTech: ...and transferable

abilityText.value: to extend your current Loop by 1

name: Temporal Aegis
flavorProject: As we travel loop after loop, paradoxes start to accrue. We need to eliminate them as they come
flavorTech: Stand against the tyranny of the Sun

abilityText.value: when you are about to gain
during the Voyage or Adventure Phase to test Diplomacy (7+)

name: Stasis Theory
flavorProject: We may be able to completely freeze sections of the Argo in time
flavorTech: Save them later

abilityText.value: to stop any loss or gain of
This loss or gain is then
Note this on your Argo Sheet
During each following Timeline Step you must gain +1
to sustain the stasis or immediately resolve the noted gain or loss

name: Moirai Operation
flavorProject: It is time to challenge the Fates themselves
flavorTech: The Moirai will not stop us

abilityText.value: Lose -1 Titan or -1 Priest to test Diplomacy (7+)

name: Extinction Contingency
flavorProject: We may be able to change reality, but the cost will be terrible
flavorTech: Here's to you

name: Argo Timeline Security
flavorProject: We need to safeguard the Argo against temporal threats
flavorTech: Each deviation investigated and catalogued

abilityText.value: when you are about to lose
during the Voyage or Adventure Phase to test Diplomacy (7+)

name: Extinction Protocols
flavorProject: The Last Academy has been listening to the echoes from the Future
flavorTech: State of the art - in the far future

abilityText.value: Crew Limit: 10, Hull Limit: 7, Time Silo: 6

name: Delphian Diplomatic Relations
flavorProject: If you are to work with the people of Delphi, you need to understand the ideologies that divide them
flavorTech: Delphi is like a broken amphora. Put it back together

abilityText.value: to gain +1 Diplomacy with the Local Faction

name: Chronopolitics
flavorProject: Stop the war by preventing it from starting in the first place
flavorTech: This type of tampering is extremely dangerous

abilityText.value: Choose 1 Faction you are At War with and immediately set your Diplomacy with this Faction to '-6'
This ability ignores the normal restrictions of the At War Diplomacy Threshold

name: Delphian Investigations
flavorProject: Scouts are sent to all corners - and times - of Delphi
flavorTech: You begin to piece together a temporal topography of Delphi

abilityText.value: After you roll on the Adventure Hubs Table, you may choose to resolve an Adventure from the hub you rolled or the one in the row directly below

name: Ultimate Trading Solutions
flavorProject: Delphi is rich in resources, we need to establish trade with its powers

abilityText.value: Exploration card to the Exploration deck

name: Intelligence Gathering
flavorProject: You're on the verge of establishing a time-spanning network of agents
flavorTech: It seems your agents were always there. Or are they leftovers from a previous loop?

abilityText.value: Exploration card to the Exploration deck

name: Delphi Peoples' Support
flavorProject: The peoples of Delphi want to break free from this time prison just as much as you do
flavorTech: The people of Delphi have a long history of rebellion against fanaticism

abilityText.value: is on an explored tile with the

name: Advanced Titan Breeding
flavorProject: The antikratos philosophers are ready to expand their Titan work
flavorTech: Your time in Sparta has left you with a few scars and a mission

abilityText.value: Lose 1 Dreamwalker Titan to note a
Event on the Timeline, 10 days from now
When you resolve this event, gain one Titan of the corresponding class
You cannot use this ability again until you resolve the event
to use Spartan Strains Breeding with Cooldown: 12 days
If you do, write the chosen Breeding event 5 days from now instead

name: Titan Care
flavorProject: A new home for your Titans
flavorTech: The Argostoa will allow the Titans to roam free

abilityText.value: when you are about to lose a Titan in the Voyage or Adventure Phase to test Diplomacy (7+)

name: Titan Genetic Memory
flavorProject: There is knowledge hidden in the Titans' blood
flavorTech: Not quite Argo-bred, yet not fully Gaia-born

abilityText.value: Add all Pattern cards you gain in Cycle III to the Gymnasion deck or form the Gymnasion deck if you haven't already: Find all Cycle I and Cycle II Pattern cards and all Pattern cards that you gained in Cycle III (except the ones currently assigned to Titans)

abilities.name: Gain +1 @ArgoFate to note a _Titan's name (Grafting)_ Event on the Timeline, 7 days from now. When you resolve this event, that Titan may gain one of the Pattern (Strain) cards from the Gymnasion deck. You cannot use this ability again until you resolve this event

name: Sun Shielding
flavorProject: The Sun seems to be against us, we need to develop proper shielding
flavorTech: Once nobody would are to even think of denying the Sun

abilityText.value: Lose -1 Frozen Time when you are about to lose
On 4+, ignore this loss or gain
and lose -1 Frozen Time to ignore its effect and gain +1

name: Quantum Propylon
flavorProject: An extension to the War Propylon, this will allow us ot react to unforseen threats
flavorTech: Drawing upon adjacent parallel timelines for support

abilityText.value: At the start of Battle, choose up to 1 reserve Argo Ability
At the start of any Titan Round, you may remove 1 of the currently prepared Argo Abilities from the Battle and put the reserved Argo Ability into play (with a full amount of charges)

name: Awakening Studies
flavorProject: You've mastered the Godforms. Is there a greater power?
flavorTech: Beyond gods

abilityText.value: You can Go Beyond (see Cycle III Storybook rules)
Lose 1 Priest to make a chosen Argonaut lose the Moirai Mistake Affliction

name: Adyton Completion
flavorProject: The Nymphs have found a new home
flavorTech: What draws them here?

abilityText.value: Lose 1 Priest to make a chosen Argonaut lose the Fractured Affliction

name: Argo Academy
flavorProject: Now you know the truth of the gods. It is your duty to pass it on, so no generation of mortals finds themselves in divine shackles again
flavorTech: Here the philosophers and academicians conduct their research, poring over dusty tomes and phos scripture

abilityText.value: When you start a new Cycle IV campaign, take all of the Combat and Structural Technology cards you have researched and remove all that have a "Cycle III only" tag
You won't need them in Cycle IV
Note that you will also have very limited use of Cycle III Production Facilities, so you may remove these cards too
if they would exceed this limit

name: Argo's Curse
flavorProject: And the voice cursed us to wander the sands like doomed Odysseus, and never find our way home. To that we say "No".
flavorTech: From here the Argonauts challenge the Dead Gods' curse and steer the mighty Argo toward the looming Tower

name: Mortal Mapmakers
flavorProject: We have broken the wheel that was said to be unbreakable. Now we must chart a course through seas unknown
flavorTech: The remnants of the final battle in Delphi found their way onboard, and the curse of Persia stacked them, like a staircase to nowhere

abilityText.value: The Exploration Deck has several cards showing your efforts to strip the accursed towering carcass of its paracausal power
These cards award you with Pitiless Divine resources
If you are on Story 2A or further, during the Advancement Phase, you may trade these resources for Cursed Derelict resources (any number of times):

name: Argo Wonders
flavorProject: Though busted and beaten, the Argo still has wonders to share: not of magic, but of dedicated hard work
flavorTech: To stand a chance against the Primordials, the smiths and priests of the Argo work tirelessly on new types of gear and new engineering solutions

abilityText.value: When instructed to apply Ascendency rules, all Gear cards with a Power Level lower than IV (and without the Ascended keyword) incur the following penalties for the remainder of the Cycle:
(Weapons only) When you attack with this weapon, you cannot use any tokens from the Kratos Pool or place any tokens in the Kratos Pool

name: Titanosyntrofia
flavorProject: With the Balaneoin ruined, the Cryptex tekne remains our sole way to interact with the Titans. We need to teach them the value of mortal life
flavorTech: Prolonged Cryptex use causes mild visual and auditory hallucinations. The Argonauts call it "dreamwalking".

abilityText.value: Each time a Titan dies in Battle, other Titans may gain +1
In addition, when a Titan survives an Obol Draw, they may gain +1
Unliked Fused Titans, Titans created through Titan Breeding don't require a Primordial Core, unless it is specifically stated

name: Law Mora
flavorProject: The Empire's bureaucratic threat must not be underestimated
flavorTech: Our negotiators have been thoroughly briefed on local trade customs

abilityText.value: when you are about to gain
during the Voyage or Adventure Phase to test Diplomcay (7+)

name: Curse Economy Basics
flavorProject: How can an Empire that runs on deficits and curses function, let alone grow?
flavorTech: There are procedures here for every circumstance, even getting cursed

abilityText.value: to add a random Cursed Trait to the next Battle
Lose -2 Priests to make one Argonaut lose any Curse Affliction

name: True Value of Life
flavorProject: The original Cryptexes had no escape mechanisms. It tells us much of their inventors. We're different
flavorTech: By training the Titans, we trained ourselves. All life is worth protecting

abilityText.value: when an Argonaut is about to die to ignore this death

name: Persian Investigations
flavorProject: The Empire's agents hold only one allegiance: to wealth. Exploit it
flavorTech: Well-paid news travels fast, even across a barren wasteland

abilityText.value: to re-roll your Adventure Hub's Table roll or gain +1

name: Sustainable Oasis
flavorProject: The Deprived are said to live in hidden oases scattered across the cursed deserts. We need to find them
flavorTech: The simplest pleasures remind you what you're fighting for

name: Archeohistorians
flavorProject: Persia, Babylon, Old Irem... This desert was once a cradle. What happened?
flavorTech: The stelae of Old Irem have been methodically destroyed, yet some traces of the past remain

abilityText.value: is on an explored Map tile with
or place 1 Progress token on Inward Odyssey

name: Curse Exchange
flavorProject: There is great wealth made here, on the misery of others
flavorTech: In Thrice-Cursed Persia, everything has a price, and for a while, you can afford to pay for it

abilityText.value: You may use this ability on

name: Plutocratic Diplomacy
flavorProject: In this place even friendship can be bought. And if not friendship, then support
flavorTech: An exchange of goods here, a promise there, and it is as if you were bonded forever

abilityText.value: Lose 6 Cycle IV Mortal resources of your choosing and gain +1
to gain +1 Diplomacy with any Faction
Instead of losing Mortal resources, you may gain +1

name: Plutocratic Agents
flavorProject: In this accursed desert, alliances change like the winds
flavorTech: For a deal to be good, someone needs to lose something

abilityText.value: and lose -1 Diplomacy with any other Faction to gain +1 Diplomacy with the Local Faction and lose -1

name: Imperial Bargain
flavorProject: The Empire serves as the ultimate mediator in all disagreements
flavorTech: Imperial peace is bought with innocent blood

abilityText.value: Choose 1 Faction you are At War with and immediately set your Diplomacy Score with this Faction to -8
Lose -3 Diplomacy with any other Faction, and gain +1
This ability ignores the normal restrictions of the 'At War' Diplomacy Threshold

name: Imperial Contact
flavorProject: We need to establish a representative to the Empire, so someone will take care of our business. For the Empire certainly won't
flavorTech: Once in the good graces of the bablos, information starts trickling down

abilityText.value: Exploration card to the Exploration deck
Whenever you have to pay with
, you may substitute one or the other by drawing a random Cursed Trait that will be added to the next Battle

name: Divine Deals
flavorProject: Some of the most powerful djinns of the Empire are said to be able to bend the Divine itself
flavorTech: Is it worth it, in the end?

abilityText.value: to replenish 1 Summon Chage, 1 Summoning, or 1 Godform

name: Sandstorm Navigation
flavorProject: The cursed winds make reliable navigation nigh impossible. Time to change it
flavorTech: This contraption is not a compass at all, but it does what it needs to

abilityText.value: to ignore the effects of the

name: Sandstorm Sailing
flavorProject: Thanks to the Bags of Aiolos, Odysseus's ship could travel long distances over silent seas
flavorTech: So too can the Argo harness the errant breath of the Anemoi

abilityText.value: When you are about to move the
two times instead, through explored tiles, in a straight line
Do not resolve any other Voyage steps on the first tile you move to

name: Odyssey Training
flavorProject: The hardships we take on ourselves willingly are the hardest to bear, but bear them we will
flavorTech: Odysseus wandered ten years so you wouldn't have to

abilityText.value: If you still follow the randomly chosen direction, lose -1

name: Merchants of the Waste
flavorProject: Dozens of caravans cross the deserts daily. You just need to know where to look
flavorTech: Demand drives the prices

abilityText.value: Exploration card to the Exploration deck

abilities.name: City Negotiation. Gain +1 @BabelianDebt to draw two Exploration cards. Choose one, discard the other. If the card gives you resources or Titans, resolve it. Otherwise, discard it without effect

name: Bankers of the Waste
flavorProject: The bankers of the Empire will gladly help you avoid imminent doom... for a price
flavorTech: So they may seal your doom later, in a most profitable manner

abilityText.value: when you are about to lose
during the Voyage or Adventure Phase to test Diplomacy (7+)

name: Argo Cloud Operations
flavorProject: By expanding the cloud fleet, the Argo will be able to maintain its presence during high altitude battles
flavorTech: What wonderful freedom! If only you had these during the Nietzschean War

name: Superior Titan Breeding
flavorProject: Though the paradox at the center of Delphi has been obiated, it irreversibly changed some of your Titan strains
flavorTech: Your time in Delphi... It showed you the only way was forward

abilityText.value: Lose 1 Dreamwalker Titan to note a
Event on the Timeline, 10 days from now
When you resolve this event, gain one Titan of the corresponding class
You cannot use this ability again until you resolve the event
to use Delphian Strains Breeding with Cooldown: 12 days
If you do, write the chosen Breeding event 5 days from now instead

name: Kiss of Mnemosyne
flavorProject: A bitter kiss
flavorTech: A love lost is a new beginning for those who dare to hope

abilityText.value: When you activate a new Argonaut, gain +1
to choose a Mnemos card from the Mnemos Vault instead, or if, you have 4+ Alpha adventures marked, gain +3
to choose 2 Mnemos cards from the Mnemos Vault instead

name: Salvage Operations
flavorProject: These cursed winds will erod you into nothingness as surely as the passage of aeons
flavorTech: Specialized recovery crews risk life and limb to retrieve lose equipment

abilityText.value: to draw a single Exploration card
If the card gives you resources or Titans, resolve it

name: The Dreamed Torus
flavorProject: Once you had a dream of a sustainable cycle of growth, decay, and rebirth
flavorTech: Others shared it

abilityText.value: to make one Argonaut lose any Curse Affliction

name: The Work is Never Done
flavorProject: This is his legacy
flavorTech: Not all tears are an evil

abilityText.value: You may use this as a
If you do, discard this card and note a
Event on the Timeline, 30 days from now
When you resolve this event, gain this card
You cannot use this ability again until you resolve this event

name: Sharing the Knowledge
flavorProject: You have sat on this trasure trove of knowledge like an ancient dragon. Maybe they are right. Maybe it is time to share your achievements with the world...
flavorTech: Here the philosophers and academicians conduct their research, poring over dusty tomes and phos scripture

abilityText.value: When you start a new Cycle V campaign, take all of the Combat and Structural Technology cards you have researched and remove all that have a "Cycle IV only" tag
You won't need them in Cycle V
Note that you will also have very limited use of Cycle IV Production Facilities, so you may remove these cards too
if they would exceed this limit

name: Voyage Home
flavorProject: The Old Priest is gone. The Argo is worse for wear. Jason holds it together. Just this one more thing...
flavorTech: The bridge, though much diminished, still servers its purpose

name: The Last Wish
flavorProject: The Last Wish of parting souls has granted the Argo a waterproof shell so it could traverse an underground river back to the Great Sea. Who knew it would become essential to your survival. Is this her providence or merely serendipity?
flavorTech: The ship can extend the Shell on command, as if it is growing it. However, without an oxygen generation system, time underwater is very limited

abilityText.value: The Exploration Deck has several cards showing your mining efforts
These cards award you with Babelian Lunacy Primordial resources
If oyu are on Story 2A or further, during the Advancement Phase, you may trade these resources for Atlantean Tekne resources (any number of times): Trading
If you're submerged at the start of the Voyage Phase, flip 1 Oxygen token

abilities.name: if you canont, either immediately surface or lose -1 @Hull instead. If you're surfaced at the start of the Voyage Phase, flip 1 Aether token. During each Movement Step, before moving, you may surface or gain +1 @ArgoFate to submerge.

abilityText.value: to submerge when the Nemesis is about ot enter your space or when prompted (the Nemesis does not move onto your tile)

name: The Future of the Argo
flavorProject: Though busted and beaten, the Argo still has wonders to share: not of magic, but of dedicated hard work
flavorTech: Repairing the Argo is far beyond your capabilities, but you will make do

abilityText.value: When instructed to apply Ascendency rules, all Gear cards with a Power Level lower than V (and without the Ascended keyword) incur the following penalties for the remainder of the Cycle:
(Weapons only) When you attack with this weapon, you cannot use any tokens from the Kratos Pool or place any tokens in the Kratos Pool

name: Shared Fates
flavorProject: Realizing they are both weapons, one way or the other, the Argonauts' bond with the Titans grows even stronger
flavorTech: Dreamwalking Argonauts report having hazy visions of faraway lands. It becomes hard for them to discern what's real and what's not

abilityText.value: Each time a Titan dies in Battle, other Titans may gain +1
In addition, when a Titan survives an Obol Draw, they may gain +1
Unliked Fused Titans, Titans created through Titan Breeding don't require a Primordial Core, unless it is specifically stated

name: Argo Crew Rebuilding
flavorProject: Persia was a harsh land, and the journey through Phlegeton grueling
flavorTech: With the Cyclades touched by an environmental disaster, there is no shortage of volunteers

name: Argo Philosophy
flavorProject: The Symmachy's ideas are rubbing off on you. You don't know if that's a good thing
flavorTech: No mortal or Titan left behind, no task too great for the many hands of the Argo

abilityText.value: when you are about to lose
during the Voyage or Adventure Phase to test Diplomacy (7+)

name: Argo Initiative
flavorProject: If you are to help these people, you first need to help yourselves
flavorTech: A few fast hemiolias traveling from polis to polis

abilityText.value: Lose 8 Atlantean Tekne resources to add the
Exploration card to the Exploration deck

name: Atlantean Investigations
flavorProject: The Cyclades are a melting pot of cultures and superstitions. You need to be able to tell truth from myth
flavorTech: Between the islands and the fallen underwater kingdom of Atlantis, there is so much lost knowledge here...

abilityText.value: to roll twice for the Adventure Hubs Table and choose one result (once)
If you roll the same result on both dice, choose the hub instead

name: Pattern Deciphering
flavorProject: The Silver Ones ruins hold many mysteries. You would do well to decipher them
flavorTech: There are at least two distinct scripts here. Also, it is very curious to find Centimanes and Babelian symbols here

abilityText.value: is on an explored Map tile with
is on an explored Map tile with

name: Scientific Debunking
flavorProject: The "Cradle of the Old Faiths" is gripped by the crude hand of superstition
flavorTech: Taking a cue from the Followers of Areté, you send out "philosopher pilgrims", to spread more accurate knowledge of the natural world

abilityText.value: when you are about to gain

name: The Peace Mission
flavorProject: With various factions and religions vying for power, the Cyclades are on the verge of a brutal civil war. You need to prevent that from happening
flavorTech: You send diplomats to the various factions, to diffuse growing tensions

abilityText.value: Exploration card to the Exploration deck

name: Cyclades Intelligence
flavorProject: As the situation in the Cyclades deteriorates, you need more concrete intelligence, also of the military kind
flavorTech: Agents are alrady here, though some of them may also work for the Symmachy

abilityText.value: Exploration card to the Exploration deck

name: Spiral Theory
flavorProject: These ruins have stood here for aeons and, curiously, the Silver Ones who counseled Atlantis did not reclaim them. Why?
flavorTech: These spiral patterns tell of the cyclical nature of the world... perhaps. Perhaps you are grasping. But it is no coincidence that sirens congregate here

abilityText.value: , instead of gaining it, you may lose -2

name: Fresher Start
flavorProject: You have burned many bridges, and the walls are closing in around you. You need to disappear
flavorTech: Weeks of planning and preparation allow you to submerge for much, much longer. You doubt the crew could survive another "silent run" like this one, though

abilityText.value: to remove the Nemesis and all Adversaries from the Map
Additionally, choose 1 Faction that is Aligned With Nemesis and immediately set your Diplomacy Score with this Faction to -9
This ability ignores the normal restrictions of the "Aligned With Nemesis" Diplomacy Threshold

name: Grassroots Diplomacy
flavorProject: Lines are being drawn, and those whose favor you're not currying are aligning themselves with the Other. You need to fight for the future
flavorTech: Establishing permanent diplomatic relations is a start

abilityText.value: Lose 4 Cycle V Mortal resources of your choosing and gain +1
to gain +1 Diplomacy with the Local Faction, or 12 Mortal resources of your choosing and gain +1
to gain +1 Diplomacy with any Faction

name: Cyclades Commerce
flavorProject: Trade and trade relations are the foundations of lasting peace
flavorTech: The Argo is in a unique position to serve as both cargo vessel and trading hub for the people of the Cyclades

name: Cyclades Information Circulation
flavorProject: There are many half-truths, lies, and myths that still shape the Cyclades. You need to combat this misinformation
flavorTech: Information is a good, especially if it is reliable

name: Underwater Scouting
flavorProject: The seabed remains woefully unexplored
flavorTech: Repurposed from Atlantean "elevators"

abilityText.value: to see the underwater side of your current or adjacent Map tile
Alternatively, for free, roll a d10

abilities.name: on a 6+, see the underwater side of your current or adjacent Map tile

name: Improved Submergence
flavorProject: Though the Last Wish was grand, it can be improved upon
flavorTech: Vacuum-sealed cargo holds are turned into oxygen tanks for longer submersion periods

name: Tight-Spaces Navigation
flavorProject: The Argo was not designed with underwater navigation in mind
flavorTech: A system of lookouts across the ship will allow for precise movement

name: Superior Submergence
flavorProject: The Atlantean cities stood on the seabed for centuries. How?
flavorTech: Repurposed Atlantean tekne allows for limited recycling of used air

abilityText.value: Use your Depths Nymph Summoning Charge to immediately flip 1 Aether token

name: Moirai Rebellion
flavorProject: No longer will the gods dictate how the world is run
flavorTech: You invite the arguments, for scrutiny and testing are how progress is made

name: Phobian Psychology
flavorProject: Crete showed tending to the wounds on the soul is as crucial as those on the body
flavorTech: Constant fear can lead to lasting anxiety, but so too can lasting help disperse it

abilityText.value: Lose -1 Priest to make one Argonaut lose any Phobia Affliction or gain 1 Fated Mnemos node
Lose -2 Priests to gain 1 Echo of Recollection Divine resource

name: Atlantean Docking Procedures
flavorProject: Atlantean airbridges allowed subremes to quickly dock with underwater cities
flavorTech: The Argo aribridge whoe length runs the entirety of the hull will tremendously speed up embarking and disembarking

abilityText.value: As long as the Local Faction is not Aligned With Nemesis, each
used to activate a Negotiation ability can be used to activate another Negotiation ability

name: Mortal Alliance
flavorProject: Through constant recruitment and unfortunate attrition, the Argo has become a true alliance of all peoples of Hellas--and beyond
flavorTech: All are welcome on the Argo

abilityText.value: When on a tile adjacent to a Map tile with a
Negotiation ability as if you were on that tile
Place the Last Visited City token on that

name: Atlantean Maintenance Procedures
flavorProject: The Atlanteans could perform miraculous repairs, even underwater
flavorTech: Though in state of great disrepair, some Atlantean maintenance facilities can still be found in Cycladean poleis; you need only restore them

name: Ultimate Titan Breeding
flavorProject: The curses of Persia had a profound and irreversible effect on some of your Titans
flavorTech: The world is yours now. And so is the responsibility

abilityText.value: Lose 1 Dreamwalker Titan to note a
Event on the Timeline, 10 days from now, or a
When you resolve this event, gain one Titan of the corresponding class
You cannot use this ability again until you resolve the event
to use Persian Strains Breeding with Cooldown: 12 days
If you do, write the chosen Breeding event 5 days from now instead

name: New Oikos
flavorProject: Even though it has been decades since they were under the gods' control, people still fear the Titans
flavorTech: The Titans of this age are docile and fall prey to mortal hunters. You will pay good money to take them off their hands and give them a better life... once all this is over

abilityText.value: Exploration card to the Exploration deck

name: Gaia's Stepchildren
flavorProject: The truth of the gods demise is as frightening as it is liberating. You need to forge a new way forward
flavorTech: Life finds a way

abilityText.value: Negotiation abilities on spaces covered by Ruins
Place the appropriate Last Visited token on that Map tile

name: Mnestis Training
flavorProject: Mock combat training will not cut it, not in these fathomless depths
flavorTech: The refined Mnestis tekne allows for on-the-fly combat situations

abilityText.value: to add a Mnestis Simulation to the Timeline, 1 day from now (See Mnestis Simulation Battles in the Storybook, p
